edu.gmu.cs.amped.client
Class Server

java.lang.Object
  edu.gmu.cs.amped.client.Server

public class Server
extends java.lang.Object

Represents a remote system which speaks the AMPED API.

Author:
luke@faraone.cc (Luke Faraone)

Constructor Detail

Server

public Server(java.lang.String apiUrl,
              org.keyczar.Verifier serverKey)
Initializes a new Server object.

Parameters:
apiUrl - URL that corresponds to the base of the API. Example: http://localhost:8000
serverKey - Verifier which contains the public key of the server
Method Detail

checkTransactionStatus

public Status checkTransactionStatus(int txnId)
Checks on the current transaction status with the server specified in apiUrl.

Parameters:
txnId - unique ID of the transaction to check
Returns:
a Status corresponding to the current status of the transaction with the server.

getApiUrl

public java.lang.String getApiUrl()
Returns:
the base URL of the server we're communicating with

getLatestTransaction

public Transaction getLatestTransaction(Device dev)
                                 throws org.keyczar.exceptions.KeyczarException
Gets the latest transaction from the server for the specified device.

Parameters:
dev - Device whose key information and identifiers are used to query the server for new transactions
Returns:
a Transaction object corresponding to the latest transaction modifiable by dev.
Throws:
org.keyczar.exceptions.KeyczarException - if signature verification fails

sendTransaction

public void sendTransaction(Transaction txn,
                            int deviceId)
Submits the Transaction to the server specified in apiUrl.

Parameters:
txn - Transaction object to send
deviceId - ID which uniquely identifies the device to the server
